--- format: html: code-fold: show code-summary: "Ocultar código" code-line-numbers: false code-annotations: false code-link: true code-tools: source: true toggle: true caption: "Código" code-overflow: scroll page-layout: full editor_options: chunk_output_type: console categories: - geom_spatraster - geom_spatvector execute: eval: false echo: true warning: false title: "Semana 33" date: last-modified author: Víctor Gauto --- Ubicación de munros en Escocia. ::: {.column-page-right} ![Semana 33, 2025](semana_33.png) ::: ## Paquetes ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(glue) library(ggtext) library(showtext) library(tidyterra) library(tidyverse) ``` ::: ## Estilos Colores. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} c1 <- "#5D2A13" c2 <- "#7F9D90" c3 <- "black" c4 <- "white" c5 <- "#20235B" ``` ::: Fuentes: Ubuntu y JetBrains Mono. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} font_add( family = "ubuntu", regular = "././fuente/Ubuntu-Regular.ttf", bold = "././fuente/Ubuntu-Bold.ttf", italic = "././fuente/Ubuntu-Italic.ttf" ) font_add( family = "jet", regular = "././fuente/JetBrainsMonoNLNerdFontMono-Regular.ttf" ) showtext_auto() showtext_opts(dpi = 300) ``` ::: ## Epígrafe ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} fuente <- glue( "Datos: ", "{{tidytuesdayR}} semana 33, ", "The Database of British and Irish Hills v18.2
www.hills-database.co.uk." ) autor <- glue("**Víctor Gauto**") icon_twitter <- glue("") icon_instagram <- glue("") icon_github <- glue("") icon_mastodon <- glue("󰫑") icon_bsky <- glue("") usuario <- glue("**vhgauto**") sep <- glue("**|**") mi_caption <- glue( "{fuente}
{autor} {sep} {icon_github} {icon_twitter} {icon_instagram} ", "{icon_mastodon} {icon_bsky} {usuario}" ) ``` ::: ## Datos ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2025, 33) scottish_munros <- tuesdata$scottish_munros ``` ::: ## Procesamiento Me interesa el mapa del relieve de la región indicando los [munros](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Munro). Extraigo la extensión de los munros y recorto el vector de los sitios. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} v <- scottish_munros |> select(Name, xcoord, ycoord) |> terra::vect(geom = c("xcoord", "ycoord"), crs = "EPSG:27700") |> terra::ext() |> terra::vect(crs = "EPSG:27700") |> terra::project("EPSG:4326") p <- scottish_munros |> select(Name, xcoord, ycoord, Height_ft) |> filter(Height_ft > 3000) |> terra::vect( geom = c("xcoord", "ycoord"), crs = "EPSG:27700" ) |> terra::project("EPSG:4326") p <- terra::crop(p, v) ``` ::: Obtengo la elevación de la región, suavizo con una ventana de 3x3 y almaceno para una lectura posterior rápida. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} e2 <- elevatr::get_elev_raster( locations = sf::st_as_sf(v), z = 10, clip = "bbox" ) |> terra::rast() e <- terra::focal(e2, fun = median, w = 3) terra::writeRaster(e, "tidytuesday/2025/semana_33.tif", overwrite = TRUE) ``` ::: Polígono de Reino Unido, con sus divisiones administrativas. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gb <- rgeoboundaries::gb_adm2(country = "GBR") |> terra::vect() ``` ::: ## Figura Defino la paleta de colores, título y extensión del mapa. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} col <- hypsometric_tints_db |> filter(pal == "meyers") |> pull(hex) triangulo <- glue("󰔶") mi_titulo <- glue( "Un munro es una montaña que supera los 3000 pies (914,4 m), en Escocia.
Se muestran en el mapa {nrow(p)} munros ({triangulo})." ) ext <- terra::ext(e) ``` ::: Mapa, con escala. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} g <- ggplot() + geom_spatraster( data = e, maxcell = prod(dim(e)) ) + geom_spatvector( data = gb2, fill = NA, color = c3, linetype = 1, linewidth = .2 ) + geom_spatvector( data = esc_crop, fill = NA, color = c4, linetype = 2, linewidth = .2 ) + geom_spatvector( data = p, show.legend = FALSE, color = c5, shape = 17, size = 2, alpha = .7 ) + ggspatial::annotation_scale( location = "bl", pad_x = unit(.3, "cm"), pad_y = unit(.3, "cm"), height = unit(0.5, "cm"), text_family = "ubuntu", text_cex = 1.2 ) + scale_fill_gradientn( colors = col ) + coord_sf( expand = FALSE, xlim = c(ext$xmin, ext$xmax), ylim = c(ext$ymin, ext$ymax) ) + labs(fill = "Altura (m)", title = mi_titulo, caption = mi_caption) + theme_void(base_family = "ubuntu", base_size = 16) + theme( plot.margin = margin(b = 15, t = 25), plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA), plot.title = element_markdown( size = rel(1.3), lineheight = 1.2, margin = margin(b = 5) ), plot.caption = element_markdown( color = c2, lineheight = 1.3, size = rel(.9) ), legend.position = "inside", legend.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = "white"), legend.justification.inside = c(1, 0), legend.key.height = unit(1.2, "cm"), legend.margin = margin(5, 5, 5, 5) ) ``` ::: Guardo. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggsave( plot = g, filename = "tidytuesday/2025/semana_33.png", width = 30, height = 35, units = "cm" ) ``` :::
